content.description: A study was conducted to investigate whether there is a difference in the mean life span of a new brand of battery compared with an older brand of battery. Independent random samples of <math alttext="9" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> new-brand batteries and <math alttext="8" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> older-brand batteries were selected, and the life span (in hours) of each battery was recorded. Summary statistics obtained from the data are shown in the table below. Assume that the conditions for inference are met.
content.question: New Brand Older Brand Mean <math alttext="426.8" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>426.8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="355.2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>355.2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Standard Deviation <math alttext="49.5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>49.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="96.7" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>96.7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Which of the following best approximates the <math alttext="p" overflow="scroll"><mi>p</mi></math>-value for a test of <math alttext="H sub 0: mu sub new, minus mu sub older, equals 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>new</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>older</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> versus <math alttext="H sub a: mu sub new, minus mu sub older, is not equal to 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mtext>a</mtext></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>new</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>older</mtext></msub><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, where <math alttext="mu sub new" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>new</mtext></msub></math> is the population mean life span of the new brand of battery and <math alttext="mu sub older" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>older</mtext></msub></math> is the population mean life span of the older brand of battery?

choices.label: <math alttext="the probability of, t is greater than the complex fraction with numerator, 426.8 minus 355.2, and denominator, the square root of the fraction 49.5 over 9, end fraction, plus the fraction 96.7 over 8, end root, end complex fraction" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>></mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>426.8</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>355.2</mn></mrow><msqrt><mfrac><mn>49.5</mn><mn>9</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>96.7</mn><mn>8</mn></mfrac></msqrt></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

topic.text: 7.9: Carrying Out a Test for the Difference of Two Population Means

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
